com.qualcomm.robotcore.util

Class CurvedWheelMotion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.CurvedWheelMotion

  • public class CurvedWheelMotion
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists of static utility functions that calculate robot motions for different drive mechanisms.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CurvedWheelMotion()

      static double getDiffDriveRobotRotVelocity(int leftVelocityInMmPerSec, int rightVelocityInMmPerSec, int axleLengthInMm)
      Calculate the rotational velocity for a differential drive robot given its left and right wheel velocities.
      static int getDiffDriveRobotTransVelocity(int leftVelocityInMmPerSec, int rightVelocityInMmPerSec)
      Calculate the translational velocity for a differential drive robot given its left and right wheel velocities.
      static int getDiffDriveRobotWheelVelocity(int linearVelocityInMmPerSec, double rotationalVelocityInDegPerSec, int wheelRadiusInMm, int axleLengthInMm, boolean leftWheel)
      Calculate the left or right wheel velocity for a differential drive robot given its translational velocity and rotational velocities.
      static int velocityForRotationMmPerSec(int rotateAroundXInMM, int rotateAroundYInMM, double rotationalVelocityInDegPerSec, int wheelOffsetXInMm, int wheelOffsetYInMm)
      Given rotational velocity where (+) is CCW, calculate linear wheel velocity where (+) is robot forward.

      • velocityForRotationMmPerSec

        public static int velocityForRotationMmPerSec(int rotateAroundXInMM,
                                              int rotateAroundYInMM,
                                              double rotationalVelocityInDegPerSec,
                                              int wheelOffsetXInMm,
                                              int wheelOffsetYInMm)
        Given rotational velocity where (+) is CCW, calculate linear wheel velocity where (+) is robot forward.

      • getDiffDriveRobotWheelVelocity

        public static int getDiffDriveRobotWheelVelocity(int linearVelocityInMmPerSec,
                                                 double rotationalVelocityInDegPerSec,
                                                 int wheelRadiusInMm,
                                                 int axleLengthInMm,
                                                 boolean leftWheel)
        Calculate the left or right wheel velocity for a differential drive robot given its translational velocity and rotational velocities.
        Note: for a skid-steering (4-wheel) robot, this calculation is approximate.
        Parameters:
        linearVelocityInMmPerSec - robot linear velocity in mm per sec (+ve = forward, -ve = reverse)
        rotationalVelocityInDegPerSec - robot rotational velocity in degrees per sec (+ve = CCW, -ve = CW)
        wheelRadiusInMm - radius of each wheel in mm
        axleLengthInMm - axle length in mm
        leftWheel - boolean indicating this is for the left wheel (true) or right wheel (false)
        Returns:
        translational left wheel velocity (along the ground)

      • getDiffDriveRobotTransVelocity

        public static int getDiffDriveRobotTransVelocity(int leftVelocityInMmPerSec,
                                                 int rightVelocityInMmPerSec)
        Calculate the translational velocity for a differential drive robot given its left and right wheel velocities.
        Parameters:
        leftVelocityInMmPerSec - left wheel velocity in mm per sec (+ve = forward, -ve = reverse)
        rightVelocityInMmPerSec - right wheel velocity in mm per sec (+ve = forward, -ve = reverse)
        Returns:
        robot translational (linear) velocity in mm per sec (+ve = forward, -ve = reverse)

      • getDiffDriveRobotRotVelocity

        public static double getDiffDriveRobotRotVelocity(int leftVelocityInMmPerSec,
                                                  int rightVelocityInMmPerSec,
                                                  int axleLengthInMm)
        Calculate the rotational velocity for a differential drive robot given its left and right wheel velocities.
        Parameters:
        leftVelocityInMmPerSec - left wheel velocity in mm per sec (+ve = forward, -ve = reverse)
        rightVelocityInMmPerSec - right wheel velocity in mm per sec (+ve = forward, -ve = reverse)
        axleLengthInMm - length of axle (distance between the wheels) in mm
        Returns:
        robot rotational velocity in degrees per second (+ve = CCW, -ve = CW)
